Introduction
RTOS_CMSISOS_RTOS001 App

Introduction

The CMSIS-RTOS API is a generic RTOS interface for Cortex-M processor-based devices. CMSIS-RTOS provides a standardized API for software components and gives therefore serious benefits to the users and the software industry.
Please refer [1] for details.

CMSIS-RTOS API app provides GUI base configuration for CMSIS-RTOS API Library provided by ARM. The CMSIS-RTOS implementation of this RTOS001 App is based on ARM RTX and is developed by ARM and is published under the popular open-source BSD license and is available for download from http://www.keil.com/demo/eval/rtx.htm. The official documentation of the used CMSIS RTX version can be downloaded separately from http://media.infineon.com/DAVE_3/CMSIS_RTX/CMSIS_RTX_Doc.zip

Scope

Scope of this App is to provide an RTOS implementation (source code) using the CMSIS-RTOS APIs and Configuration for CMSIS-RTOS API layer.

RTOS001_abbreviation

  1. OS : Operating System
  2. RTOS: Real Time Operating System
  3. RTX: Real Time Executive
  4. CMSIS: Cortex Microcontroller Software Interface Standard

RTOS001_reference

cmsis documentation can be downloaded from :
[1] http://www.onarm.com/Cmsis/
[2] To view updated version of the CMSIS RTOS API documentation Click here

RTOS001_limitation

[1] This port of RTX does not start main as a thread.
[2] Starting the Kernel shall be triggered from user code by explicitly calling the 'osKernelStart()' API.
